sentence: Unilever PLC ( UL ) will begin trading ex-dividend on February 15, 2018.
A cash dividend payment of $0.44 per share is scheduled to be paid on March 21, 2018.
Shareholders who purchased UL prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This represents an 5.52% increase over prior dividend payment.
The previous trading day's last sale of UL was $53.08, representing a -11.72% decrease from the 52 week high of $60.13 and a 28.03% increase over the 52 week low of $41.46.
UL is a part of the Basic Industries sector, which includes companies such as Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) and Unilever NV ( UN ).
Zacks Investment Research reports UL's forecasted earnings growth in 2017 as 29.33%, compared to an industry average of 16.5%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the UL Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.
